definition: to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: He was held back a year and still winces if anyone mentions it.
sentences.chinese: 他留級一年，如果有人提到這事他仍然畏畏縮縮。

sentences.english: She winced at the mention of the dog.
sentences.chinese: 一提到那隻狗，她就嚇得畏畏縮縮。

sentences.english: Bebrave, don’t hold back on what you really want to say.
sentences.chinese: 勇敢一點表達你真正想說的，不要畏畏縮縮。

sentences.english: Please help yourself, don't hang back.
Be declarative, not mousy, in affirming the truth of the paper and the weight of its evidence.
sentences.chinese: 不要畏畏縮縮，大方肯定自己的研究發現與重要佐證。

definition: to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to murder without blinking an eye (idiom)/ruthless/cold-blooded
to whisper to one another's ear
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
